5F529A2F237C4CCA913FFC693E3D5F3E.description: Engage in group playing (e.g., sharing tracks digitally, small groups, large groups).

D63880C63C334287B8DC0CAF5DCA7D8B.description: Participate in class rehearsal discussions when problem solving.

6A8534743CE5459688C862333492F19D.description: Demonstrate leadership as a guitar player (e.g., offering help and guidance to other guitar players in class, being prepared for class).

5F0C66F29DF34D9D99992BB51993EC13.description: Create and use own practice plan to improve and prepare for rehearsal.

E6B4883800754A01B0E9EAE1F3C8CC0A.description: Play in time with other guitar players

4034141DBB9A4710BCEFC27601B0A159.description: Investigate the skills, techniques and attitudes necessary for successful group performances.

88EE418A4FE24ECA89B45778163593CC.description: Explore the use of the guitar as an accompanying instrument in Métis fiddle music and kitchen parties.

633E3CFDFCA24DC583D520985DDEF9F9.description: Explore live and recorded First Nations and Métis guitar performances.

E5ABA0FCC6D34D2EB96B3D633776EEF1.description: List the characteristics of the guitar playing in First Nations and Métis music.

266D160D439F444C8C805194EA5F3FA7.description: Use, with teacher guidance, musical terminology when describing guitar playing of self and others (e.g., using the elements of music to describe the guitar playing).

5D232289EC084D3DAB364C4BE8DAD765.description: Listen to the music of contemporary Saskatchewan First Nations and Métis guitar players and songwriters.

8D1D71F2367B4C869C803274B92DCEF8.description: Establish one’s own guitar goals and apply the steps necessary to achieve those goals.

FF0CD272E5FE45A5A1A0A4F12621E5DF.description: Develop and use criteria to evaluate one’s own practice plan.

241E96DDE7FF44A2AD91BF2AFE97C7FF.description: Plan the required steps to achieving one’s personal guitar goals.

E49AF476F26345FCB623BF43CC817F83.description: Discuss the elements of effective planning for personal guitar playing growth.

62B9B9E4DD4C4304AD018AE013367D43.description: Identify resources (e.g., apps, practice trackers, games, motivation, lessons) to support practice plans.

9CDE77BA17704C92B6C20D6936986A9D.description: Identify potential obstacles to practicing and brainstorm possible solutions.

602CFC22F0E943FD8D948D9FEB9B7313.description: Create a personal inventory to investigate the impact and role of music in one’s own life.

72D14A6F1CF54BBCAE9248356101D185.description: Design, implement and evaluate, with teacher guidance, a personal practice plan.

F97D726A90784C78B81BC468710870F2.description: Explore live and recorded guitar performances

FB1164BA0491407CA09F92BB388A3F6D.description: Practise ear training while listening (e.g., finding keys).

D7473DECFF154499BFD758924854F0E2.description: List basic characteristics of a guitar player.

F2A717D42AB54BC6905700E22A63CEF7.description: Identify the chords in a song using the harmonized scale.

2F91DDA5B7CA4E798223DC94B8D385E1.description: Use, with teacher guidance, musical terminology when describing guitar playing of self and others (e.g., using the elements of music to describe the guitar playing).

3F3C7B9B17BE4B88954FE87AC742FA89.description: List characteristics of various guitar genres (e.g., rock, country, pop, hip hop).

DC0BCDFC32F44D7D8D5DF9F4D7C54340.description: Listen to and describe the guitar playing of self and others.

D8175E0935584DEEB8BD7793E1628324.description: Critical/Responsive (CR) Goal: Students will respond to artistic expressions of Saskatchewan, Canadian and International artists using critical thinking, research, creativity and collaborative inquiry.

7BFB2A0C5BB6488C82EB2EF4F8A4C87E.description: Recognize that the sharing of guitar music has evolved throughout history for producers and consumers.

B71373F3BFDD4AA6B7E7669511A51C62.description: List the ways guitar playing can remain part of one’s life beyond school.

CF4825814EC846D9BFB017486C182F47.description: Explore how guitar music is infused in daily life (e.g., to influence consumers via advertising, shopping environments) including media (e.g., film, video games, television, social media, apps).

EB43B350CAB442F8B41D32061887912E.description: Investigate the ways that different genres/styles of music influence one’s wellbeing (e.g., mood, anxiety, sense of peace, identity).

C12A2C72F0844222B2FC839A44111296.description: Identify the relationship between guitar playing and personal wellness, including mental health (e.g., music therapy, social connection).

FB2857E50B7340A2B22815CFCAC556D2.description: Describe the impact and role of guitar playing in personal life and identify music careers and pathways for continuing engagement in music.

BA24F32B5BF446D8A043B4F7C0759CD5.description: Research Canadian Indigenous artists whose contemporary guitar music is influenced by traditional Indigenous music.

F939976AC82B41BA8FDFD3517C178DE5.description: Draw on the experience of local guitar players (e.g., community performances, collaborative workshops, adult musicians, guest artists from diverse cultures) to examine their work and careers and to improve one’s own practice.

416DC3FC89444A908167782BCF1A0892.description: Conduct an inquiry into how guitar players are influenced throughout their development.

8D74D148199D4078981F303AC9E7DD50.description: Explore how guitar players influence and respond to social, political and cultural issues (e.g., representing gender and sexual diversity, concern for environmental sustainability or human rights, world music activists).

29A7B57CE0C948E2BAC7F603E45BA30D.description: Investigate what makes a guitar player influential.

2A7788DA47884C71BFAEE680D573AC77.description: Identify and listen to the work of local, Canadian and international guitar players.

04D6FB2FC26747C598732F717938D1E6.description: Explore the lives and work of local, Canadian and international guitar players.

C1D49AFD3BF14D70A0F1A68D6C581496.description: Practise particular genres of music in a stylistically appropriate manner (e.g., genres and styles might include rock, blues, country, classical, fingerstyle, metal, Hawaiian slack key, Celtic, surf, funk, flamenco, r&b/soul, reggae/ska, Brazilian).

1C03C634C9574016B086A25423A91EDD.description: Describe guitar music from a variety of cultures and periods throughout history.

4C7372910A484DB6AF13ABA46AB1DE19.description: Explore historical information from a variety of cultural and historical contexts.

B66989B377554F2986DBAA07592EB273.description: Recognize a range of traditional and contemporary guitar music selections.

FB2D4AD96991499FB34D74C97FB7C680.description: Identify and play guitar music from a variety of cultural and historical contexts

50C7C76D01AA4DAD830AFC56CBC78750.description: Cultural/Historical (CH) Goal: Students will investigate the content and aesthetics of the arts within cultural, historical and contemporary contexts and understand the connection between the arts and the human experience.

BCEB35DE35294B2D854F4444C854FAF4.description: Apply, with teacher guidance, aural skills to recreate a short piece.

D329BD8FD5E14928AF1CFB7B63982C2E.description: Identify beginner rhythmic values in 4/4 time (e.g., quarter note, whole note, half note, eighth note).

EB3F034764714C63B0821B6AF3FCD43A.description: Explain time signature and howto count and play in 4/4 time signature.

01B7A39BB1B84478B36A7BB98D8A4EE3.description: Identify the elements of music (e.g., dynamics, form, harmony, melody, rhythm, texture, timbre, tonality).

94C6577542A74A67886F5E8F42F206FA.description: Examine music theory and how it is used in musical expressions/ideas/compositions.

D88A40045CE348FE991B9CCCC59CC573.description: Read and play in 4/4 time signature.

D15933E001854F1A981105C73BBF0E54.description: Play beginner strumming patterns using basic chords.

892860672C364523A82856293497F207.description: Demonstrate, with teacher guidance, the use of musical notation to interpret and express musical ideas.

D50EE025CCB9443E9447A8F48961A36A.description: Play in a group and perform for peers or others (e.g., share and layer recorded tracks with peers).
